title: Interoperability as growth driver
description: No integrations are yet available with well adopted DID frameworks.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem and solution statements are clear and reasonable.
The goal of providing interoperability of Atala Prism with Hyperledger and DIF Sidetree to attract more DID users aligns with the challenge objective.
The proposal is able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users.  
I concur with the proposal argument that this interoperability is required to become a leading provider of DID services. 
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links.
The team has been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal.
The budget is reasonable to achieve the goals and is broken down into identifiable items.
The timetable is realistic to complete the work and shows what is being done and when.
The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal however based upon scope there probably are none.
The proposal does not have an explicit risks and challenges to a successful implementation section however it does identify the risk that Atala Prism may be delivered with some of this functionality already, in which case that part will be disregarded and the budget and timeline have been structured to easily facilitate this removal. The proposal also includes biweekly reports that contain risk assessments.
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with auditable milestones and a defined timeline. The deliverables are very clearly defined with the  "commitment to the transparency of the allocated funds, we expect payments based on above deliverables without the need of advance payments."  
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user. As a "plugin", the number of DID users projected would be 0 however the proposal should project out to a timeline in which the community could expect DID users to be recruited assuming future funding. When could the community expect the challenge objectives to be measurably met if this project were funded? 
The proposal details specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals. "The project implementation will follow Agile management based on Jira Cloud tools. Jira users can be created for follow up and auditability. Additionally, a bi-weekly report will be publish with project progress, mayor milestones and risk assessment."
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Although Decentralized Identity (DID) is a novel technology, it has been around for years and there exist several challenges that must be addressed with regards to standardization and interoperability. W3C DID Working Group and DIF foundation are making great efforts in that direction and hence many solutions with real use cases were developed with those concepts in mind. This proposal aims to address several issues, and 4 Catalyst Members have given this proposal kudos!
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is highly educated and his background includes a MS EE degree at Stanford University and more than 25 years of successful work experience in both large multinational companies and owned startup projects. His main activities involve architecting, developing, and implementing large scale software solutions for the Telecommunication Industry. He leads multi-disciplinary and multinational teams in the Caribbean and Latin America. The plan for this proposal is presented well and there is a high probability of success.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are four deliverables that constitute the main metric of progress and success:
Part 1 Documentation
Part 2a Universal Resolver driver
Part 2b Hyperledger Aries plugin
Part 2c DIF Sidetree plugin

the proposal is easy to audit based on the milestones, but the ultimate metric with be user adoption.

f6_assessments.q0: I found this proposal very interesting and realistic. I think we can define the authors' goals with the following excerpt: "ready to use" plus Cardano's advantages over other blockchains will drive adoption in the short and long term." The idea here is to use existing structures and structures used in other DIDs to the Atala Prism ID, which in my view is extremely useful, since this security in the known can attract new users to Cardano, adding value to our ecosystem and perfectly matching the objectives of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the author's ability to develop the project, we have a complete and highly satisfactory description about him, which includes his training area, time of experience, branches he worked/works and even more a linkedin profile attached, where we can know him more intimately. He also shows interest in hiring another developer, already establishing what the characteristics of this one would be and how he intends to hire him, that is, everything is already very well organized and secure. So, as far as the team is concerned, I believe the proposal is perfect. Here we have an explanation of what would be done, quite differently from the other proposals, as I will detail below, and a brief but sufficient notion of how the funding money would be spent.
f6_assessments.q2: The author prefers to explain his project in a different way than most proposals. It does establish a timeline, but they focus on the first two parts, which seem to be most important to understanding how the project works. During the explanations, he includes a series of information about what would be composed of each of them. I found it positive that in the first part they thought not only about the blockchain adept audience but also people outside our community or another blockchain, and we know that this portion is still the majority. They are very realistic, as they consider both options - whether the Atala Prism DID is already released or not. They also set a 2-week time frame for this first step. And then they explain the second one, focusing on the concept of plug-ins, with an estimated duration of also 2 weeks. Regarding the currency division, we have basic information about; however, I have found enough to understand this part of the proposal. As this is a very technical project, I can't see the community as a whole following the success metrics, it might be interesting if a select set of developers from the Cardano community were chosen to monitor the progress of the project.

solution: Facilitate documentation and integration code to the broad DID community so Cardano can be considered as a suitable player in the ecosystem.
experience: Strong academics and 25+ years of proven experience in architecting and developing software solutions for the telecom industry.
